title: It does what is claims.
body:
It indeed works perfectly well on Nespresso capsules, as well as Dolce Gusto capsules. A slight complaint would be that the water amount setting is not perfectly compatible with either capsule types, and you'll have to choose between adding in somewhat more water than what is recommended, or a bit too little. I have not noticed that this would make a significant difference in the quality of the coffee, though.

What is a slightly bigger issue is that the amount of water it pushes through varies based on what I can only guess is the amount of resistance to the water flow. Sometimes the Americana it makes from a capsule is almost half the volume it is at other times. Ok, in these clear instances I can add more water manually, but this is sub-optimal.

The machine makes quite a decent coffee from ground coffee through the espresso 'head' it comes with.

Making espresso from ground coffee is a bit tricky, though, and if you mainly use it for such, I recommend buying a proper espresso machine.

It is worth noting, that using too fine ground coffee can cause a blockage and slight problems where the pressure inside causes the lever to seem to be stuck until the pressure slowly releases and the handle can be opened again. When this happened to me, I was close to tearing off the entire handle. Despite using considerable force, I did not manage to do so, which is only a testament to how sturdy it is.

All in all, I can recommend this for people who want variety for their coffee moments, because I can't really imagine how you could get any more variety than with this machine.

PS. The Kotlie customer service was very polite and helpful when I contacted them about the handle being stuck. They immediately offered a refund, which I did not end up needing and the problem went away simply by waiting.

title: Best Coffee I've Had For A While
body:
When I first opened the box and started setting things up... I was a little confused by the ground coffee tray design. I then referred to the manual where you have clear instructions of how to use each individual tray/pod combo, machine maintenance, settings, etc. But... there was nothing about how to remove the normal coffee grounds metal basket.

It seems a little silly but I practiced a lot on how to insert/remove the metal basket from the tray before ever adding any coffee. It's much different from what I'm use to where you simply take the basket out and dump it when you're done. Instead, this basket drops in and twist locks to the left. I practiced how to take it out by pushing down on the outside corners, then twisting right to unlock. Even then I needed to grip the basket from inside to get it out. I did not see any tool included to remove it, so I think this is what you have to do.

After all the practice I finally added some grounds, tamped it down, inserted the tray and brewed one of the best cups of coffee I've had in a long while! When it came time to remove the grounds, the best way I found was by rinsing them down the drain. I know this isn't best practice, but it's easier than wrestling to get the basket out of the tray with the grounds still in it. I haven't tried any pods yet, but it looks like they get easily discarded with the packaging. This was the main reason I purchased this machine. That way I'll be ready no matter what type of pods go on sale rather than not being compatible.

The rest of the machine operates fiarly straight forward. You fill the pitcher with water in the back where you can clearly see the levels if you need to add more. The panel is smart touch and heats up in under a minute. Simply select the temperature, water amount, and whether or not you want to pre-soak for added flavor. I really am digging this machine though and can recommend it as long as you don't mind rinsing your regular grounds down the drain when you don't use the pods.

Fast forward to this little machine, courtesy of Vine and here I am, living the coffee dream. I am sure other reviews will point out pit falls etc, but for me, as a first time user, this has been really easy.

The drip tray is removable and you can then attach it higher up for smaller cups, and is easily cleaned too. It has a nice metal tray and a plastic base.
All in all, for me, a super first introduction to the world of coffee machines, and I think we are going to have a lot of fun!
